column4: I'm wondering what the best way to upgrade from 11.10 to 12.04 -- gosh darn I hate upgrading
distupgrade?
it has its uses
my little tower of pandaboards run gentoo, for example
why not something else?
it's small and to the point
besides i can customize and debug, for example, framebuffer driver easily
Id have no idea how to customize a framebuffer driver even if I wanted to
use low-bandwidth X then?  nomachine's maybe?
it's not bandwidth that kills you.  it's the latency.
no.  you just have to use solutions like, ok, Exceed onDemand (commercial)
with EOD, we can work interactive in San Jose (CA) from, for example, Austin (TX) without noticeable delays
there are free solutions too (like nomachine's NX i told you about)
no machine is worse than just tunneling x -- plus it crashes a lot with me
sometimes you have to go graphical.  for example, what about ilo / drac from half a continent away?  you surely don't suggest getting on a plane to push a button :-)
never used those programs, so I really wouldn't know

in case you're interested, ilo and drac are dell (and hp, in that order)'s implementation of video and keyboard/mouse input/output over the network, so that you can manage every aspect of a machine over a network where the machine might not be in the same city you're in
uh i got the order reversed
Sounds like a dream...if it works
shhhhhh, it's vnc.  it's not "real X"

i *think* he's talking about the virtual resolution on the vnc server side ... unless he's talking about the client side, which he hasn't made clear ... i'm assuming he meant the server side (which is headless)
